meanings.definition: To taste or sample food or drink before it is officially served or consumed.
meanings.sent1: I enjoy pretasting the soup to make sure it's seasoned just right.
meanings.sent2: The chef always pretastes the dishes before they are served to the customers.
meanings.sent3: Before the dinner party, I couldn't resist pretasting the dessert to satisfy my curiosity.
meanings.sent4: Pretasting the wine, she could already tell it was going to be a delightful evening.
meanings.sent5: The pretasting of the new menu items left everyone excited for the upcoming event.

meanings.definition: The act of evaluating the taste or quality of something before it is fully experienced.
meanings.sent1: Her pretasting of the cake helped her decide on the perfect flavor for the party.
meanings.sent2: The pretasting of the coffee beans allowed them to select the best ones for the blend.
meanings.sent3: The pretasting of the ice cream flavors turned into a fun game with friends.
meanings.sent4: His pretasting of the new restaurant's menu left him eager to try more dishes.
meanings.sent5: The pretasting of the cookies made the baking process even more enjoyable.
